RelatedSentence: Six years after his first arrest , French rogue trader Jerome Kerviel has begun a three - year prison term for his role in the near collapse of Societe Generale bank .

After a weekend of high drama in which he had threatened to stay in Italy in a bid to get president Francois Hollande to intervene in his case , the 37 - year - old finally surrendered to police at midnight after crossing the border at the Riviera town of Menton .

The ex-trader brought one of Europe 's biggest banks to the brink of bankruptcy in 2008 with wildly risky trades which resulted in a loss of â‚¬4.9bn .
Kerviel was convicted in 2010 of breach of trust , forgery and entering false data in relation to the unauthorised trades .
His conviction and three - year prison term were upheld in March but an appeal court overturned an order that he pay damages equivalent to the bank 's losses .
